The gangsters were reportedly planning to carry out acts of terror.

350.title: Drunk man bites flight attendant's finger, punches him in Istanbul flight; video surfaces
350.article_body: An Istanbul-Jakarta Turkish Airlines flight was forced to make an emergency landing after a drunk passenger got into a fight with flight attendants. The passenger identified as a pilot of different carrier bit a flight attendant's finger. A video showing the passenger punching a flight attendant is being widely circulated on social media.

351.title: SL's Shehan Karunatilaka wins £50,000 Booker Prize for 'The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida'
351.article_body: Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunatilaka won the 2022 Booker Prize for Fiction for his novel 'The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida'. The book centers around the killing of a war photographer in Colombo in the 1990s and explores life after death amid a Sri Lanka beset by civil war. Karunatilaka bagged a prize money of £50,000.

352.title: Pic of Scotland bowler looking at a note while bowling in T20 World Cup 2022 goes viral
352.article_body: A picture of Scotland spinner Mark Watt looking at a note while bowling during his team's T20 World Cup 2022 match against West Indies has gone viral on social media. The 26-year-old, who recorded bowling figures of 4-0-12-3 in his team's victory, later took to Twitter to reveal what was written on the note. "Don't bowl slot," the note read.

353.title: Man dies after he hits speed breaker, falls from bike in Pune
353.article_body: A 46-year-old man died when he fell from his bike after hitting a speed breaker on the Katraj-Dehu Road bypass in Pune. The deceased may have failed to see the speed breaker as it wasn't properly marked, according to police. A sub-inspector said that the deceased suffered head injuries and died on the spot. The incident took place last week.

354.title: Bus crushes B'luru woman's legs as she falls off scooter due to pothole
354.article_body: A 50-year-old woman's legs were crushed by a bus after she fell off a scooter while her daughter, who was driving the vehicle, tried to evade a pothole in Bengaluru. The woman also suffered injuries on her head and abdomen. Reports said that the road was up for repairs but could not be repaired due to heavy rainfall.

355.title: Pic of leopard eel's CT scan shared by US zoo goes viral
355.article_body: Picture of a leopard eel's CT scan which was shared by US' Point Defiance Zoo and Aquarium has gone viral on social media. "Zoo Veterinarian, Dr Kadie, identified a mass in the eel's mouth that was likely due to a broken tooth," the zoo wrote. Reacting to the picture, a social media user said, "I thought it was an art."

356.title: Billionaire Louis Vuitton CEO sells private jet after people track it on Twitter
356.article_body:
Bernard Arnault, the CEO of LVMH and the world's second-richest person, revealed that the luxury-goods company sold their private jet after people set up Twitter accounts tracking their flights.
The 73-year-old billionaire said he has now been renting private jets. Arnault has an estimated net worth of $137 billion, as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

357.title: 27-year-old man stabbed to death over argument in Delhi, 2 arrested
357.article_body: Police arrested two men for allegedly stabbing to death a 27-year-old man following a heated argument in Delhi's Chirag Delhi area. The two accused worked as domestic help in south Delhi, and one of the accused was apprehended within five hours, police said. The second accused was arrested at New Delhi Railway Station, police added.

358.title: Woman's naked body found stuffed in suitcase in Gurugram; FIR filed
358.article_body: An FIR has been filed after the naked body of an unidentified woman was found stuffed in a suitcase near IFFCO Chowk in Gurugram on Monday, police said. "A preliminary probe has found that the woman was murdered elsewhere and her body was...dumped here," DCP (West) Deepak Saharan said. He added that efforts are underway to identify the deceased.

359.title: No water supply for 24 hours in parts of Mumbai today
359.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced a 24-hour water supply cut in parts of Mumbai today. The water supply will be disconnected from 10 pm on October 17 to 10 pm on October 18. The supply will be hit because of the cross connection work of newly laid 750 mm water main with existing 600 mm dia, BMC said.

360.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is super exciting, we're all looking forward to it: Katrina
360.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said her upcoming film 'Jee Le Zaraa' with Priyanka Chopra and Alia Bhatt is a "super exciting film" and they are "all looking forward to it". "That film has had its journey...but I think when finally it does happen, it's gonna be a lot of fun," she added. 'Jee Le Zaraa' was announced in 2021.

361.title: Karim Benzema wins Ballon d'Or for the first time ever
361.article_body: Real Madrid and France forward Karim Benzema won the Ballon d'Or for the first time ever. The 34-year-old scored 44 goals in 46 appearances for Real Madrid last season and won the La Liga and Champions League with the Spanish club. Benzema is the fifth French player to win the Ballon d'Or and the first since Zinedine Zidane in 1998.

362.title: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S to join Cognizant to lead its Americas market
362.article_body: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S, who resigned from Infosys last week, will join Cognizant on January 16, 2023, as President of Cognizant Americas. He will also be joining Cognizant's executive committee and will be based in New York, as per reports. Kumar has over 20 years of experience in the consulting, process and technology transformation space.

363.title: J&K group protesting Kashmiri Pandit killing remove Hurriyat board
363.article_body: A group protesting against the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit by terrorists removed the signboard of the All Parties Hurriyat Conference at Rajbagh in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian. The protestors also threatened to hold protests outside the Pakistan Embassy in New Delhi. "They (Hurriyat) have been only doing lip service...They should have held protests against these killings," said a protestor.

364.title: Reb Bull in a favourable position for 2023 season: Mercedes F1 boss
364.article_body: Mercedes F1 CEO Toto Wolff said Red Bull will be "in a very favourable position" at the beginning of the 2023 season. "We have missed a lot of development time to find out about bouncing and porpoising...I think we can catch up quickly," said Wolff. "There is no team (in any sport) that is winning every single championship," he added.

365.title: Qatar to host AFC Asian Cup 2023; India, Saudi Arabia shortlisted for 2027
365.article_body: After hosting the 2022 FIFA World Cup, Qatar will host the Asian Cup 2023, said the Asian Football Confederation (AFC). The All India Football Federation and the Saudi Arabian Football Federation have also been selected as the final two bidders for the tournament's 2027 edition. A decision on the same host for 2027 will be taken in February 2023.

366.title: Army issues tenders for 363 high & medium-altitude logistic drones
366.article_body: The Indian Army has issued initial tenders for the procurement of 363 drones to "boost its logistics chain and enhance operational preparedness". While 163 drones would be for high-altitude regions, 200 will be for medium-altitude areas. Medium-altitude drones should be able to carry at least 20 kg of payload, while high-altitude drones should carry 15 kg, the proposal said.

367.title: Bumrah a big loss, Shami seems a good replacement: Sachin Tendulkar
367.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said Indian pacer Mohammad Shami "seems a good replacement" for the injured Jasprit Bumrah in T20 World Cup 2022. "Bumrah not being there is a big loss and we obviously needed a strike bowler...who could attack batters and get wickets," said Tendulkar. He added a captain should pick spinners during T20 World Cup based on ground dimensions.

368.title: Teams overspending are effectively cheating: McLaren F1 CEO to FIA
368.article_body: McLaren F1 CEO Zak Brown told the FIA that teams that breach the sport’s cost cap are “effectively cheating”. “Bottom line is any team who has overspent has gained an unfair advantage...in the current and following year’s car development,” said Brown. The FIA have found that Red Bull breached the 2021 cost cap set for them.

369.title: Fighter jet crashes into apartment building in southern Russia
369.article_body: A Russian Sukhoi Su-34 crashed into a nine-storey apartment building in the southern Russian city of Yeysk on Monday, the regional governor said. The crash caused a fire in the building that "engulfed several floors at once", the governor of the Krasnodar region added. The fighter jet crashed during a training flight from a military airfield, news agency RIA reported.

370.title: Goal this year to take a catch that could go down as one of my best: Hardik
370.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that his goal for 2022 is to take a catch that can be considered one of his all-time best. "I am able to spend a lot of time on my fielding with our coach (T Dilip). I was always natural as a fielder, but I want to be exceptional," Pandya said.

371.title: What a year she has had: Navratilova after Swiatek's 8th title of 2022
371.article_body: Eighteen-time Grand Slam champion Martina Navratilova took to Twitter after world number one Iga Swiatek won her eighth title of 2022 and wrote, "What a year Iga has had!!!" The 21-year-old Pole's eight titles this year include two Grand Slams (French Open, US Open), four WTA 1000s (Doha, Indian Wells, Miami, Rome) and two WTA 500s (Stuttgart, San Diego).

372.title: 3 masked men shoot cashier, run away with cash in Rajasthan
372.article_body: Three masked men fired at a bank cashier before robbing him of ₹4 lakh in the Sapotra block of Rajasthan's Karauli district on Monday. The three unidentified accused had come on a bike and were carrying country-made pistols, police said. The bank management has registered a case against the accused who are being identified through CCTV footage, police added.

373.title: CBI denies Sisodia's claims that he was asked to quit AAP for BJP during questioning
373.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Monday issued a statement refusing Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's allegations that he was asked to leave AAP and join BJP during questioning in the Delhi excise policy scam case. "CBI...reiterates that his examination was carried out in a professional and legal manner," the statement read. Sisodia claimed he was offered Delhi CM's post.

374.title: Pity it took so long for us to play in a World Cup: Zimbabwe captain
374.article_body: Zimbabwe captain Craig Ervine said it is "a pity" that it took "so long" for the team to play in a World Cup match. "To put in a performance like that in the first game back in the World Cup, we showed we belong," said Ervine, after his team defeated Ireland. Zimbabwe last featured in the 2016 T20 World Cup.

375.title: Switch to survival mindset: Suniel Shetty after Byju's fires 2,500 employees
375.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty reacted to Byju's firing 2,500 employees in a cost-cutting measure and said, "[It] was a tough one to swallow." Saying that the layoffs likely affected 10,000 people, Shetty, without naming the company, said, "This is a good time for early-stage...businesses to establish a few operating principles...If you're not seeing growth, switch to a survival mindset."

376.title: Special to be back where it all changed for me: Neeraj at Thank you Tokyo event
376.article_body: After attending the 'Thank you Tokyo!' event, Tokyo Olympics gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra tweeted, "Had a great time at the Tokyo 2020 commemoration ceremony today." "And [it] was a special feeling being back at the stadium where it all changed for me," he added. The event commemorated the successful hosting of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics last year.

377.title: Rahul should stop Bharat Jodo Yatra & concentrate on Himachal, Guj: Cong MP
377.article_body: Congress MP Francisco Sardinha said Rahul Gandhi should stop the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and concentrate on the poll-bound states of Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. He added that Congress is the "only party" which can defeat the BJP. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is very important, said Sardinha, adding that he now wants Rahul 'to stop immediately'.

378.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh meets African counterparts
378.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday held discussions with his counterparts from Ethiopia, Mauritania, Gambia, Ghana and the Central African Republic ahead of the India-Africa Defence Dialogue which is scheduled for Tuesday. The dialogue will be held on the sidelines of DefExpo 2022 in Gandhinagar, the Defence Ministry said. The first India-Africa Defence Dialogue was held in Lucknow in 2020.

379.title: PVR reports wider than expected Q2 loss at ₹71 crore
379.article_body: Multiplex operator PVR announced that it has reported a bigger-than-expected net loss of ₹71.23 crore for the quarter that ended September. PVR, in its exchange filings, said admissions and average ticket prices suffered due to the weak performance of Bollywood and Hollywood movies. Revenue from operations jumped 470.7% on year to ₹687 crore, but slumped 30% from the previous quarter.

380.title: V-Mart acquires e-commerce startup LimeRoad in a ₹31-crore deal
380.article_body: Fashion retailer V-Mart Retail said it is set to acquire e-commerce startup LimeRoad for lump sum cash of around ₹31.12 crore. The company, in its regulatory filing, said it plans to invest ₹150 crore to scale and achieve sustained profitability. According to the filings, LimeRoad clocked net revenue of ₹179.95 crore in 2019-2020 which dropped to ₹69 crore in 2021-2022.

381.title: T20 has extended life of a professional cricketer: Ex-Aus coach
381.article_body: Former World Cup-winning coach John Buchanan said that the T20 format has extended the life of a cricketer. "I was there for the Legends League Cricket," Buchanan said. The Australian added, "That (veteran leagues) in itself creates more interest on the basis that you can play T20 now for a long period of time and still return [with] reasonable money."

382.title: If Cong gets united, then only India will get united: Mani Shankar Aiyar
382.article_body: Former Union Minister Mani Shankar Aiyar said that if the Congress gets united, then only India will get united. "All these questions, that...who will become the PM, all these can be answered when the right time comes," Aiyar said. He added, "But today, we need to unite the Congress, and... 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is the first step."

383.title: Piramal Pharma to list shares on October 19
383.article_body: According to a BSE notice, the equity shares of Piramal Pharma Limited shall be listed and admitted to dealings on the exchange in the list of T Group of Securities on October 19. The shares would be listed at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma was demerged from Piramal Enterprises to simplify the company's corporate structure.

384.title: UP govt offers rebate on land stamp duty for setting up new textile units
384.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Rakesh Sachan said under the new Handloom and Textile Industry Policy-2022, entrepreneurs will get a 25% rebate on the purchase of land. The government will also offer up to 100% exemption from stamp duty for setting up a textile unit in the state. The minister said that it aimed at attracting ₹10,000 crore in private investment.

385.title: OFI Global, other funds to sell 5.29 crore equity shares in Zee: Report
385.article_body: OFI Global China Fund and other Invesco-managed funds are reportedly planning to sell 5.29 crore equity shares held in Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd. The deal size represents around 5.51 percent of the total shares outstanding in the company. The price for the deal was reported to be in the range of ₹250 to ₹263.7 per share.

386.title: India crash out of 2022 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup after conceding 16 goals, scoring 0
386.article_body: Hosts India have crashed out of 2022 FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup after conceding 16 goals and scoring 0 in the group stage. India lost to Brazil 0-5 today after having lost to USA 0-8 and to Morocco 0-3. USA and Brazil have advanced to the next stage of the tournament from India's group.

387.title: Mohammad Shami meets Shaheen Afridi, gives him bowling tips; pics go viral
387.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami met Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi and gave him bowling tips in Brisbane. Videos and pictures of their interaction has gone viral. In a video, Shaheen can be heard saying, "I'm following you since I started bowling and from that time I've been a big fan of your wrist position and upright seam."

388.title: 21 Indian wrestlers to miss U-23 World Championship after visa rejection by Spain Embassy
388.article_body: The embassy of Spain has denied visas to 21 Indian wrestlers, who were to compete at the U-23 World Championship in Pontevedra, on suspicion that they will not leave the territory before the expiry of visas. The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) had picked a 30-member squad for the Championship, that began on Monday, but only nine were granted visas.

389.title: Replacing 'phone banking' with 'digital banking' promoted growth: PM
389.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India's sustained economic growth has been possible due to the BJP government's efforts to replace pre-2014 'phone banking' with 'digital banking'. Under 'phone banking', instructions were given to banks on phones, PM Modi said. Any country's economy is as progressive as its banking sector's strength, he added.

390.title: Germany starts programme to take in Afghans deemed most at-risk
390.article_body: The German government on Monday launched a programme to take in Afghan citizens who are considered to be at a high risk of facing persecution under Taliban rule. Under the programme, 1,000 Afghans and their family members will be admitted to Germany every month. The programme targets individuals associated with women's and human rights advocacy, politics, justice and other fields.

391.title: Roche Pharma sets up data analytics center in Hyderabad, 2nd in India
391.article_body: Swiss multinational healthcare company Roche Pharma has set up a state-of-the-art Global Analytics and Technology Centre of Excellence (GATE) in Hyderabad. The centre, reportedly India's second, will work with the global affiliates of Roche to advance knowledge and understanding of the healthcare space. Meanwhile, Telangana Minister KTR said, "I'm delighted to welcome Roche Pharma to Hyderabad."

392.title: Who is Abdul Kardar, the new inductee in PCB Hall of Fame who has played for India too?
392.article_body: Abdul Hafeez Kardar has been inducted into Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Hall of Fame. He's Pakistan's first-ever captain. He was born in Lahore on January 17, 1925 and made his Test debut for India in 1946. He played three Tests for India, scoring 80 runs. After Partition, he represented Pakistan in 23 Tests, scoring 847 runs and taking 21 wickets.

393.title: Man kills sleeping stray dog by hitting brick on its head in UP, video surfaces
393.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man killing a sleeping stray dog by hitting a brick on its head in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The Uttar Pradesh Police took cognisance of the viral video and arrested the accused for animal cruelty. "This kind of inhuman act is unforgivable," the police said.

394.title: Fake CBI began 'raids' on Mumbai businessmen during demonetisation
394.article_body: Goregaon Police said the gang posing as CBI officers to rob businessmen began their racket during demonetisation. They would collect information on those who wanted their money converted and "raid" them. Police said they are looking into more victims after one businessman recently came forward about being kidnapped and robbed of ₹50 lakh by the gang in July.

395.title: Govt school teacher suspended for sexually abusing student in Assam
395.article_body: A government school teacher was suspended for allegedly sexually abusing a student on the premises of the institute in Assam's Kamrup district, an official said on Monday. A police case has been registered against the accused, the official added. A show cause notice was served to the teacher by Kamrup Inspector of Schools Apurba Thakuria on October 14.

396.title: Once you get used to Australian conditions, you can get lot of runs: Hardik
396.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that he was always excited to come to Australia and get so much time to prepare for the T20 World Cup. "In Australia, it's about one inning. If you can get the inning early in the season, once you get used to the conditions, you can score a lot of runs," Pandya said.

397.title: US woman saves for 30 years to fund her ₹2 cr trip to see the Titanic's wreckage
397.article_body: An American woman named Renata Rojas saved money for over 30 years to fund her trip to see the wreckage of the Titanic ship which sank in 1912. Renata spent $250,000 (around ₹2 crore) for the trip to the bottom of the North Atlantic Ocean to see the remains of the ship which sank 110 years ago.

398.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Yashoda' to release on November 11
398.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday announced the release date of her movie 'Yashoda'. The film will be released on November 11. It will arrive in theatres in multiple languages, including Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada and Hindi. 'Yashoda' has been directed by Haresh Narayan and K Hari Shankar.

399.title: No Kejriwal to tutor Sisodia during CBI questioning: Amit Malviya
399.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia needs to be reminded that "he has been summoned for corruption and is not going for Satyagrah". Malviya added that Sisodia has to face the CBI alone and "there will be no Kejriwal to tutor" him. He said Rahul Gandhi too had thrown "similar tantrums" but still recorded his statements.

400.title: You gave me company when I faced a tough time as child: Arjun to Sanjay Kapoor
400.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram on Monday to wish his uncle Sanjay Kapoor on the occasion of his birthday. In a video message, Arjun said, "You've given me company when I faced a tough time as...child." "I...want to thank you from the bottom of my heart, for being such a positive person, who's so full of life," he added.
